meanings.definition: The study of the way in which living organisms interact with each other and their environment.
meanings.sent1: In bionomies, scientists observe how animals and plants live together.
meanings.sent2: Ecologists use bionomies to understand how different species depend on each other.
meanings.sent3: The bionomies research team found out that the ants were throwing parties with the bees.
meanings.sent4: The delicate bionomies of the forest were like a symphony of life.
meanings.sent5: Through bionomies, we can see the intricate dance of nature's balance.

meanings.definition: The branch of biology that deals with the relations between living organisms and their environment.
meanings.sent1: Bionomies explores how animals adapt to changes in their surroundings.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in bionomies study how pollution affects wildlife populations.
meanings.sent3: The bionomies class had a field trip to observe how squirrels interact with trees.
meanings.sent4: The bionomies of the ocean are a complex web of life and survival.
meanings.sent5: Learning about bionomies helps us appreciate the interconnectedness of all living things.
